intro: Baeria macrantha var. bakeri, commonly known as the Baker's baeria, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces showy, yellow-orange inflorescences that attract pollinators. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it prefers full sun and minimal water.
